hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After Stress Events
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >15% drawdown within 5 days (stress event), subsequent liquidity recovery creates a predictable 3-7 day reversal pattern where price rebounds to fill 65-80% of the gap before resuming trend.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market makers and institutional desks systematically reload liquidity after forced liquidations. The 70% retracement target aligns with typical market maker inventory rebalancing levels before ceding control to trend followers.
entry_conditions: Cumulative volume delta turns positive after 2 consecutive negative days
Funding rates flip from negative to neutral (between -0.005% and +0.005%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 70% retracement of the stress drawdown range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the stress low by 2%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of stress events lead to continuation rather than reversal, or average retracement fails to exceed 50% of drawdown.
